ENGLISH CATALOGUE

Giving TITLES Classified under Author and Subject in one Strict Alphabet,
with particulars of Size, Price, Month of Publication,
and Name of Publisher of
THE BOOKS ISSUED IN GREAT BRITAIN AND IRELAND IN 1900
AND THE PRINCIPAL BOOKS PUBLISHED IN AMERICA.
BEING A CONTINUATION OF THE 'LONDON' AND 'BRITISH CATALOGUES.

THE PUBLISHERS' CIRCULAR & BOOKSELLERS' RECORD of BRITISH & FOREIGN LITERATURE
is published by Messrs. SAMPSON Low & Co. Limited, every Saturday. Price Three-halfpence.
In addition to a Leading Article and Notes and Announcements of Literary Interest
it gives full particulars of all New Books published during the Week.
LONDON:
SAMPSON LOW, MARSTON & COMPANY, LIMITED,
PUBLISHERS' CIRCULAR OFFICE, ST. DUNSTAN'S HOUSE, FETTER LANE, FLEET STREET, E.C
1901.


## p. 2 (#6) ################################################

04191
325
1900
PREFATORY NOTE.
To this volume is appended a List of Works on Angling, Fish, and
Fisheries, which supplements the Bibliotheca Piscatoria published in 1883
by Mr. T. Satchell. We must thank the Hon. D. B. Fearing, of Newport,
R.I., U.S.A., for the loan of his catalogue of angling books, from which
many of the entries in this list were obtained.
The names and complete addresses of publishers will be found at the
end of this volume. Under the book titles the names of the publishers are
given in brief: 'Low,' for instance, instead of the 17 words and two letters
which will be found at the foot of the title-page of this book. If the office of
a publishing firm is not in London, the name of the town is placed between
parentheses before the publisher's name, thus: '(Oxford) BLACKWELL.' Then
the publisher's name, the word 'publisher,' and the name of the town usually
make address enough to find him.
For the first time we have added a List of the principal publishers in
the United States. It will be found following the names of those in the
United Kingdom.
Collections, Libraries, and Series of books will be found grouped under
the heading Series. Publications issued by Learned Societies should be
sought for under the heading Transactions. We regret that some pub-
lishers and secretaries of societies did not reply to our circular in time
to allow us to include their information in this volume, but it will appear
eventually in Vol. VI. of the English Catalogue of Books.
To those many publishers and secretaries who by kind and prompt
replies have assisted us to complete this list of English books published
in 1900 we tender hearty thanks. We have especially to express our
obligation to Mr. W. K. FORTESCUE (compiler of a Subject Index to
Modern Works), and to many bibliographers and authors who have
sent additions or corrections.
Should any of our readers notice the absence of a title which ought
to have appeared in this volume, or know of the publication of a work
which will not be subscribed to the trade in the usual way,' or for any
other reason is likely to escape our next volume, we shall be much obliged
if he will send copy of title, giving name of author, price of book, name of
publisher, and month and year of publication, to Catalogue Dept.,
S. LOW, MARSTON & CO., LTD.,
St. Dunstan's House, Fetter Lane, E.C.

1900.
The word printed in Italics in the Classified' lines is that under which the book will be
found described in the entries commencing in thick type.
In addition to the names of book sizes, such as cr. 8vo., royal 8vo., &c., the sizes are also given
where possible in inches, 1 inch = 2 centimetres.

## p. 237 (#241) ############################################

A LIST OF BOOKS
RELATING TO
FISH, FISHING, AND FISHERIES
TO SUPPLEMENT THE
BIBLIOTHECA PISCATORIA
OF
T. WESTWOOD and T. SATCHELL
PUBLISHED IN 1883.
This List includes Works published between 1883 and 1900,
and some older Books not mentioned in the
'Bibliotheca Piscatoria.'
LONDON:
SAMPSON LOW, MARSTON & COMPANY
(LIMITED),
St. Dunstan's house,
FETTER LANE, FLEET STREET, E.C.
1901.


## p. 238 (#242) ############################################

NOTE.
THE following List of Works on Angling, Fish, and Fisheries has
been compiled from various sources, and includes all the more
important works published since the appearance of The Bibliotheca
Piscatoria in 1883, as well as particulars of some works previously
published not mentioned in that work. For many of the entries I
am indebted to an American angler and subscriber to the Fishing
Gazette, the Hon. D. B. Fearing, of Newport, R.I., U.S.A. I shall
be greatly obliged to collectors of angling books and others who will
send me a note of any corrections in, or omissions from, this list
which they may notice. They should be addressed to R. B. Marston,
Editor Fishing Gazette, St. Dunstan's House, Fetter Lane, London.


## p. 239 (#243) ############################################

C. pp. 8-175, port., illus., 8vo. cloth, $4 net. [Of the
original of this work, published by the Author at

46 & 47 Vict., c. 22 (1883). Sea Fisheries Act-An
Act to carry into effect an International Conven-
tion concerning the Fisheries in the North Sea, and
to amend the laws relating to British Sea Fisheries
47 Vict., c. 11 (1884). Freshwater Fisheries Act-An
Act for the further protection of fish, other than
Salmon, in Fresh-Waters
47 & 48 Vict., c. 48 (1884)-An Act to promote the
cultivation of Oysters in Ireland
47 & 48 Vict., c. 21 (1884)-An Act to provide for the
better administration of the fund under the control
of the Trustees to aid the Sea and Coast Fisheries
of Ireland; and for other purposes in relation
thereto
47 & 48 Vict., c. 27 (1884)-An Act to further amend
the Sea Fisheries Act, 1868
48 & 49 Vict., c. 70 (1885)-An Act to amend the law
relating to Scottish Sea Fisheries, and for other
purposes relating thereto
48 & 49 Vict., c. 79 (1885)-Crown Lands Act. [Sec-
tion 8 refers to the extension of duration of lease
to foreshore comprised in oyster or mussel fishery
order, 81 & 32 Vict., c. 45 & 10 Geo. 4th, c. 50,
section 22.]
49 Vict., c. 2 (1886)—An Act to declare the meaning
of section 11 of the Freshwater Fisheries Act, 1878,
so far as regards eels
49 & 50 Vict., c. 39 (1886)-An Act to amend the law
relating to Salmon and Freshwater Fisheries
51 & 52 Vict., c. 30 (1888)-An Act to amend the
Fisheries Acts in Ireland
51 & 52 Vict., c. 54 (1888)—-An Act for the regulation
of the Sea Fisheries of England and Wales
52 & 53 Vict., c. 74 (1889)-An Act to enable the
Inspectors of Irish Fisheries to prohibit steam
trawling within a certain distance of the coast of
Ireland
52 & 53 Vict., c. 23 (1889)-An Act to amend the
Herring Fishery (Scotland) Acts, and for other
purposes relating thereto
58 & 54 Vict., c. 10 (1890)-An Act to amend the
Herring Fishery (Scotland) Act, 1889
54 & 55 Vict., c. 20 (1891)-An Act for the better
preservation of the Pollen Fisheries in Ireland
54 & 55 Vict., c. 28 (1891)-An Act to amend the law
respecting the branding of herrings on the coast of
Northumberland

54 & 55 Vict., c. 37 (1891). Fisheries Act, 1891—An
Act to carry into effect an International Declara-
tion respecting the North Sea Fisheries, and to
amend the law relating to Sea Fisheries and
Salmon and Freshwater Fisheries
55 & 56 Vic., c. 50. Salmon and Freshwater Fisheries
Act 1892-An Act to amend the law relating to
Salmon and Freshwater Fisheries
56 & 57 Vict., c. 17. North Sea Fisheries Act, 1893
-An Act to carry into effect an International Con-
vention as to the Liquor Traffic in the North Sea
57 Vict., c. 2. Behring Sea Award Act, 1894-An
Act to provide for carrying into effect the Award of
the Tribunal of Arbitration constituted under a
Treaty between Her Majesty the Queen and the
United States of America
57 & 58 Vict., c. 26. Sea Fisheries (Shell Fish)
Regulation Act, 1894-An Act to extend the
powers of local fisheries committees with respect
to Fisheries for Shell Fish
58 & 59 Vict., c. 29. Fisheries Close Season (Ire-
land) Act, 1895-An Act to amend the Fisheries
(Ireland) Acts, 1842 to 1891, by providing the right
of appeal in certain cases
58 & 59 Vict. c. 42. Sea Fisheries Regulation
(Scotland) Act, 1895-An Act for the better regu-
lation of Scottish Sea Fisheries
59 & 60 Vict., c. 18. Fisheries (Norfolk and Suffolk)
Act, 1896.-An Act to amend the Fisheries Acts
relating to Norfolk and Suffolk
61 & 62 Vict., c. 56. Local Taxation Account
(Scotland) Act, 1898-An Act to make provision in
regard to the distribution and application of
further sums from time to time paid to the Local
Taxation (Scotland) Account. [Provides for the
application of the sum of fifteen thousand pounds
in each year for providing and maintaining vessels
for marine superintendence, and otherwise for the
enforcement of the Scottish Sea Fisheries Laws
61 & 62 Vict., c. 28. Mussels, Periwinkles, and
Cockles (Ireland) Act, 1898.-An Act to develop
the Fisheries of Mussels in Ireland.

[Reprint of Chatto & Windus's edition of 1875.]
Walton (I.), and Cotton (J.)-The Compleat Angler.
Lea and Dove edition. Ed. with Lives of Walton
and Cotton, by R. B. Marston, Editor of the Fishing
Gazette. Contains a reprint (by permission) of the
Chronicle of the Compleat Angler, by Thomas West-
wood and Thomas Satchell. Over 50 full-page photo-
gravures, printed from copper plates on fine plate
paper, of views on the Lea, Dove, &c., and nearly 100
small wood engravings of river scenery from original
drawings by F. Carless, dispersed throughout the
text. Frontispiece to Vol. 1: Photogravure Portrait
of Walton, from the painting by Huysman in the
National Gallery. Frontispiece to Vol. 3: Photo-
gravure Portrait of Charles Cotton, from the painting
by Sir Peter Lely. Edition de Luxe in 2 vols. royal
quarto, on best English hand-made paper, the full-
page photogravures being on India paper mounted
on plate paper, and the wood engravings printed on
India paper. In full dark green morocco, gilt top.
Limited to 200 copies for the United Kingdom, and
50 copies for America (each copy numbered and signed)

DIRECTORY OF PUBLISHERS.
This list of publishers, with their addresses, has been principally compiled with a view to supplying informa-
tion regarding the books in the English Catalogue for 1900. This will explain the inclusion of many firms in the
list who can scarcely, in the strict acceptation of the term, be called publishers, since the publication of books
forms only an occasional portion of their business.

Chancery Lane, W.C.

SPECIAL OFFER.
Indispensable to
Every Library.
The Publishers of the English Catalogue have decided to
offer to Readers of the PUBLISHERS' CIRCULAR, for a limited period only,
the following volumes of the English Catalogue at a
greatly reduced price :-
Vol. 3.-1872-1880

84s. net.
N.B.-Vol. 5 is classified in one alphabet, and therefore requires no Index Volume.
Here are five volumes in all, the published prices of which, as can be seen,
amounted to a sum of £11. 8s.
THESE ARE NOW OFFERED AT FOUR GUINEAS NET
THE SET OF FIVE VOLUMES.
WHAT THE OFFER MEANS.
Vol. 5, until to-day, could only be obtained for £4. 48.; an expenditure of the same
sum will now give you four additional volumes-the five all bound in half leather.
We make a present, that is to say, of four books published at 428., 52s. 6d., 188. and
31s. 6d. respectively.
WHY THE OFFER SHOULD BE ACCEPTED.
Because it is a chance that will never occur again. We cannot offer Vols. 1 and 2
because they are out of print. Vol. 3 is getting low, and the time must come,
sooner or later, when Vols. 4 and 5 will get scarce. They will not be reprinted.
Those who have already purchased Vol. 5 and are in want of the
preceding Two Volumes and Indexes can be supplied with them for Two Guineas Net
Cash-otherwise the offer for the set cannot be broken.
The ENCYCLOPEDIA BRITANNICA can be reprinted..
The ENGLISH CATALOGUE cannot.
Those persons who are fortunate enough to possess the Five Volumes of the English
Catalogue and Index Volumes can find the title, author's name, and published price of any
book published from 1835 to 1897. 300,000 books were published during those sixty years.
We cannot offer you the five complete volumes, but we do offer you the last three and two
Index Volumes, which give you the books published from 1872 to 1897; but the available sets
are few, and you must order quickly on the following or similar Order Form:-
ORDER FORM.
To Messrs. SAMPSON LOW, MARSTON & CO., LTD.,
St. Dunstan's House, Fetter Lane,
London, E.O.
Date
